sections.text: not to be governed by this chapter.

sections.heading: purpose.The purpose of this chapter is to afford a constitutionally sufficient, fair and orderly administrative procedure and review in connection with determinations by municipal authorities which involve constitutionally protected rights of specific persons which are entitled to due process protec
sections.text: purpose.The purpose of this chapter is to afford a constitutionally sufficient, fair and orderly administrative procedure and review in connection with determinations by municipal authorities which involve constitutionally protected rights of specific persons which are entitled to due process protection under the14th amendmentto the U.S. constitution.

sections.heading: of administrative determinations
sections.text: Any person having a substantial interest which is adversely affected by an administrative determination of a governing body, board, commission, committee, agency, officer or employee of a municipality or agent acting on behalf of a municipality as set forth in s.68.0

sections.heading: reviewable.The following determinations are reviewable under this chapter:
sections.text: reviewable.The following determinations are reviewable under this chapter:

sections.heading: not subject to review.Except as provided in s.68.02, the following determinations are not reviewable under this chapter:
sections.text: not subject to review.Except as provided in s.68.02, the following determinations are not reviewable under this chapter:

sections.heading: included.In this chapter, “municipality” includes any county, city, village, town, technical college district, special purpose district, or board or commission thereof, and any public or quasi-public corporation or board or commission created pursuant to statute, ordinance, or resolution, but does n
sections.text: included.In this chapter, “municipality” includes any county, city, village, town, technical college district, special purpose district, or board or commission thereof, and any public or quasi-public corporation or board or commission created pursuant to statute, ordinance, or resolution, but does not include the state, a state agency, a corporation chartered by the state, or a school district as defined in s.115.01 (3).

sections.heading: authority defined.“Municipal authority” includes every municipality and governing body, board, commission, committee, agency, officer, employee, or agent thereof making a determination under s
sections.text: 68.01, and every person, committee or agency of a municipality appointed to make an independent review unde

sections.heading: aggrieved.A person aggrieved includes any individual, partnership, limited liability company, corporation, association, public or private organization, officer, department, board, commission or agency of the municipality, whose rights, duties or privileges are adversely affected by a determination o
sections.text: aggrieved.A person aggrieved includes any individual, partnership, limited liability company, corporation, association, public or private organization, officer, department, board, commission or agency of the municipality, whose rights, duties or privileges are adversely affected by a determination of a municipal authority.

sections.heading: determination to writing.If a determination subject to this chapter is made orally or, if in writing, does not state the reasons therefor, the municipal authority making such determination shall, upon written request of any person aggrieved by such determination made within 10 days of notice of such
sections.text: determination to writing.If a determination subject to this chapter is made orally or, if in writing, does not state the reasons therefor, the municipal authority making such determination shall, upon written request of any person aggrieved by such determination made within 10 days of notice of such determination, reduce the determination and the reasons therefor to writing and mail or deliver such determination and reasons to the person making the request. The determination shall be dated, and shall advise such person of the right to have such determination reviewed, the time within which such review may be obtained, and the office or person to whom a request for review shall be addressed.

sections.heading: for review of determination.Any person aggrieved may have a written or oral determination reviewed by written request mailed or delivered to the municipal authority which made such determination within 30 days of notice to such person of such determination

sections.text: Act 82 and through all Supreme Court Orders and Controlled Substances Board Orders filed before and in effect on January 30, 2026.Published andcertifiedunder s. 35.18. Changes effective after January 30, 2026, are designated by NOTES.(Published 1-30-26)
